snippet.title: Johnny Depp's ex wife Amber beams as she arrives at court for day two of battle
snippet.description: Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now  Hollywood star Johnny Depp is appearing in court again today for the second day of his libel trial.   The US actor, 57, is suing News Group Newspapers (NGN), the publisher of The Sun, over a 2018 piece which described him as a "wife beater".  Depp strenuously denies his ex-partner Amber Heard's claims that he was violent to her during their short marriage.   During a dramatic opening day at London's Royal Courts of Justice yesterday, the Edward Scissorhands star admitted to having given cannabis to his then-13-year-old daughter Lily-Rose Depp and throwing a wine bottle across a room during a fight with his friends.   The court was also shown video of Depp filmed by Heard, 34, showing him smashing glasses while allegedly in a drunken rage.   Read More Related Articles    But the actor said Heard had been violent towards him and had tried to provoke him on multiple occasions.   The court was shown a picture supposedly showing gruesome injuries suffered by Depp at the hands of his then-wife.   Depp claimed he had part of his finger severed when Heard threw a vodka bottle at him.   Today's top showbiz stories    The actor's libel case relates to a 2018 column by Sun journalist Dan Wootton which said Depp shouldn't be allowed to appear in the upcoming film adaptation of JK Rowling's Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them because he was a "wife beater".  Depp is claiming to have suffered a substantial loss in earnings as a result of the coverage the piece received.  10:47Anthony BlairDepp 'saw Heard take cocaine in front of him' Ms Wass said Depp then told her for the first time about his alter-ego The Monster. "No ma'am,'' Depp replied. Ms Wass said Ms Heard tried to help Depp with his drink and drug problems and told him she knew "all about it" because both her mum and dad had been drug users. But Depp said Ms Heard never tried to help him and encouraged him to drink and take drugs. Ms Wass said though Ms Heard had tried cocaine at 18 she no longer took it. Depp said Ms Heard told him she'd tried it at 16 and had taken it during their relationship. He said there "were many times in our relationship early on" when he saw Heard take cocaine in multiple ways. "My eyes have seen it," he said.10:42Anthony BlairLawyer claims Depp 'slapped Heard for laughing at tattoo' Depp admits he changed arm tattoo "Winona forever" to "wino forever" after splitting from actress Winona Ryder. "It seemed fitting,'' he said. Sasha Wass QC, for NGN, said the first time Depp hit Heard was in March 2013 at her house after he had fallen off the wagon and she had laughed at the tattoo. Ms Wass suggested said he was disappointed with himself for falling off the wagon and was sensitive about it. She alleged he slapped her in the face. Depp replied: "That is not correct. That's not true. It did not happen.'' Ms Wass said Ms Heard did not react and "eyeballed" Depp so he slapped her agai
